item.title: Trump Is Silent on Taiwan After Talking to Xi—and That Is Fine With Taipei
item.description: Taiwan is making the most of the U.S.’s policy of “strategic ambiguity,” even as President Trump’s stance raises concern for some.

item.title: Nexperia Urges China Unit to Restore Chip Flow Amid Fears of Supply Squeeze
item.description: The Chinese owner of Nexperia, Wingtech Technology, in response called on its Dutch subsidiary to enter talks over control of the company.

item.title: Where Trump Sees Deals, Russia and China See a Chance to Disrupt U.S. Alliances
item.description: Moscow and Beijing have played to the president’s dealmaking, rattling America’s security partners.

item.title: Three Arrested as Hong Kong Fire Death Toll Rises to at Least 65
item.description: Authorities pointed to a failure to meet building-safety standards as a possible reason for the spread of the blaze that engulfed a high-rise complex.

item.title: Japan’s New Leader Infuriated Beijing. She Isn’t Backing Down.
item.description: Workaholic Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi is riding high despite the perils of a fight with Beijing.

item.title: Trump, After Call With China’s Xi, Told Tokyo to Lower the Volume on Taiwan
item.description: Japan, a U.S. ally that had angered China on Taiwan, found the message worrying.

item.title: Vanke’s Bid to Delay Bond Payment Sparks Selloff in Chinese Developers
item.description: China Vanke’s proposal to delay repayment on a two billion yuan onshore bond due Dec. 15 triggered selloffs in the sector.

item.title: China’s Xi Calls Trump in Unusual Move to Discuss Taiwan, Ukraine
item.description: The two leaders spoke as Washington, Kyiv and Moscow try to hammer out a plan to end the Russia-Ukraine war.

item.title: The Failed Crusade to Keep a Rare-Earths Mine Out of China’s Hands
item.description: The failure of one Western company to build a China-free rare-earths supply shows how Beijing has come to dominate the supply.

item.title: Why China Still Can’t Tolerate Christians and Other Believers
item.description: Recent arrests highlight Beijing’s deep ideological hostility to religious life, which flourishes even in the face of repression.

item.title: Will India and China Be Able to Resist U.S. Sanctions on Russian Oil?
item.description: New Delhi and Beijing have so far resisted U.S. calls to stop buying Russian crude, but far-reaching sanctions will be hard to ignore.

item.title: Japan’s New Leader Infuriated Beijing. She Isn’t Backing Down.
item.description: Workaholic Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi is riding high despite the perils of a fight with Beijing.

item.title: China’s Xi Calls Trump in Unusual Move to Discuss Taiwan, Ukraine
item.description: The two leaders spoke as Washington, Kyiv and Moscow try to hammer out a plan to end the Russia-Ukraine war.
